[{'created': '2020-08-18 12:05:29.000000000', 'message': "Pull congress from GitHub to address CI failures after deprecation

Congress is no longer included in the CI image builds, which means
that when the opendev URL is translated to a local file path in
'get-ansible-role-requirements.yml' CI builds for stable branches
such as Ussuri fail.

This patch aims to pull the congress source from GitHub's archive
copy in order to force the CI jobs to pull from the remote.

Change-Id: I85089d9d1c63d1585e02da2ccaadbed20f356ae0
"}]
commit_message:
Pull congress from GitHub to address CI failures after deprecation

Congress is no longer included in the CI image builds, which means
that when the opendev URL is translated to a local file path in
'get-ansible-role-requirements.yml' CI builds for stable branches
such as Ussuri fail.

This patch aims to pull the congress source from GitHub's archive
copy in order to force the CI jobs to pull from the remote.

Change-Id: I85089d9d1c63d1585e02da2ccaadbed20f356ae0

[{'created': '2020-08-20 13:44:35.000000000', 'message': "db: fix database migrations when name includes dash

If the name of the database used includes a dash, it will fail the
migrations with an error like this:

  You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to
  your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '-cell0 DEFAULT
  CHARACTER SET utf8' at line 1

Even more difficult, any future migration fails with the instances table
already existing making it very hard to troubleshoot.  This patch fixes
it by wrapping the schema name in the query.

Change-Id: Ic96dc415396985737b5bdeffed61077af5f245e6
"}, {'created': '2020-08-20 13:45:28.000000000', 'message': "db: fix database migrations when name includes dash

If the name of the database used includes a dash, it will fail the
migrations with an error like this:

  You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to
  your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '-cell0 DEFAULT
  CHARACTER SET utf8' at line 1

Even more difficult, any future migration fails with the instances table
already existing making it very hard to troubleshoot.  This patch fixes
it by wrapping the schema name in the query.

Closes-Bug: #1892370
Change-Id: Ic96dc415396985737b5bdeffed61077af5f245e6
"}]
commit_message:
db: fix database migrations when name includes dash

If the name of the database used includes a dash, it will fail the
migrations with an error like this:

  You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to
  your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '-cell0 DEFAULT
  CHARACTER SET utf8' at line 1

Even more difficult, any future migration fails with the instances table
already existing making it very hard to troubleshoot.  This patch fixes
it by wrapping the schema name in the query.

Closes-Bug: #1892370
Change-Id: Ic96dc415396985737b5bdeffed61077af5f245e6

commit_message:
Enable nova anti-affinity in two-node act-stdby job

Production deployments are recommended to run on active-standby
loadbalancer topology and with nova anti-affinity enabled for higher
level of availability. Job octavia-v2-act-stdby-dsvm-scenario-two-node
will test Octavia under such configuration.

Task: 40413
Story: 2007943

Change-Id: Iab24754bf6881671091a06047767f8b4dc8b5420

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-22 07:34:44.000000000', 'message': 'Remove an assignment from domain and project

When you setup a user with a role assignment on a domain
and then a role assignment on a project "acting as a domain",
you can't actually remove them. The database throws you the
error "Multiple rows were found for one()" since it gets two
results for "actor_id" with the same "target_id".

This patch fixes this problem by filtering the database query
by "type" field to determine whether it is a user domain relation
or a user project and then removing the assignment.

Change-Id: Ife92a3c9e0982baafb4224882681c0855f573580
Closes-Bug: #1754677
'}, {'created': '2020-06-22 09:14:16.000000000', 'message': 'Remove an assignment from domain and project

When you setup a user with a role assignment on a domain
and then a role assignment on a project "acting as a domain",
you can't actually remove them. The database throws you the
error "Multiple rows were found for one()" since it gets two
results for "actor_id" with the same "target_id".

This patch fixes this problem by filtering the database query
by "type" field to determine whether it is a user domain relation
or a user project and then removing the assignment.

Change-Id: Ife92a3c9e0982baafb4224882681c0855f573580
Closes-Bug: #1754677
'}]
commit_message:
Remove an assignment from domain and project

When you setup a user with a role assignment on a domain
and then a role assignment on a project "acting as a domain",
you can't actually remove them. The database throws you the
error "Multiple rows were found for one()" since it gets two
results for "actor_id" with the same "target_id".

This patch fixes this problem by filtering the database query
by "type" field to determine whether it is a user domain relation
or a user project and then removing the assignment.

Change-Id: Ife92a3c9e0982baafb4224882681c0855f573580
Closes-Bug: #1754677

commit_message:
Disable docker mirror temporarily

Currently we're getting rate limited and until recently we weren't
actually leveraging the cache. In order to work around this, let's stop
funneling all our docker.io requests through a single IP.

Change-Id: Ia39e562bbb76b5c13e559b4e4d499123a6531ac8
Related-Bug: #1889122

The default setting is jobboard disabled while jobboard remains an
experimental feature.

Change-Id: I063d832f5a049d7ae38378766200c7f82a35996d
'}]
commit_message:
Allow amphorav2 to run without jobboard

This patch adds a new configuration setting to enable/disable jobboard
functionality in the amphorav2 provider. When disabled, the amphorav2
provider behaves similarly to the amphora v1 provider.

The default setting is jobboard disabled while jobboard remains an
experimental feature.

Change-Id: I063d832f5a049d7ae38378766200c7f82a35996d

commit_message:
Fix operational status for disabled UDP listeners

Disabled UDP listeners appeared as ONLINE, as the heartbeat message
always showed listeners as OPEN, even if disabled.

This commit fixes the configuration file for UDP listeners, previously
enabling or disabling a UDP listener created the same config file. Now
disabling a UDP listener explicitly adds a comment in the file.

Based on this comment, the heartbeat message doesn't include status
updates for disabled UDP listeners.

Story: 2007979
Task: 40605

Change-Id: I400dde533f78bc14ee568bfd9714eafac97e8a39

[{'created': '2020-06-09 06:10:34.000000000', 'message': 'Removes the delta file once image is extracted

For live snapshot 100% copy of the original file using
libvirt/qemu to sync the disk to it using "Shallow" mode
(this is the .delta file). From that .delta file it extracts
the image and uploads it. When concurrent snapshots happening
in a multiple VM's on a hypervisor leads to disk space issue,
3x required for keeping the '.delta' file until the extracted
image gets uploaded.

Fixes bug 1881727

When creating a live snapshot of an instance, nova creates a
copy of the instance disk using a QEMU shallow rebase. This
copy - the delta file - is then extracted and uploaded. The
delta file will eventually be deleted, when the temporary
working directory nova is using for the live snapshot is
discarded, however, until this happens, we will use 3x the
size of the image of host disk space: the original disk,
the delta file, and the extracted file. This can be problematic
when concurrent snapshots of multiple instances are requested
at once.

been extracted and is no longer necessary.

commit_message:
Removes the delta file once image is extracted

When creating a live snapshot of an instance, nova creates a
copy of the instance disk using a QEMU shallow rebase. This
copy - the delta file - is then extracted and uploaded. The
delta file will eventually be deleted, when the temporary
working directory nova is using for the live snapshot is
discarded, however, until this happens, we will use 3x the
size of the image of host disk space: the original disk,
the delta file, and the extracted file. This can be problematic
when concurrent snapshots of multiple instances are requested
at once.

The solution is simple: delete the delta file after it has
been extracted and is no longer necessary.

Change-Id: I15e9975fa516d81e7d34206e5a4069db5431caa9
Closes-Bug: #1881727

commit_message:
Fix listener tls_versions and tls_ciphers clearing

Clearning tls_versions was throwing a TypeError ('NoneType' object is
not iterable). This patch fixes that and resets tls_versions and
tls_ciphers to their default values set in the API configuration file.

Task: 40607
Story: 2007981

Change-Id: I4540bbb2cb5b1200b268300cb8a9f0ad1e5104a9

commit_message:
Decouple the ISO creation logic from redfish

Currently the functionality of creating the ISO and floppy images
is tightly coupled with the redfish boot interface implementation.
Move this to a common place so that this can be levereged when needed.

Change-Id: Iea1991690e28d31a54afeaf5231ddc5798c8213c
Story: #2007940
Task: #40405

commit_message:
Use resource_backend for volumes and groups

resource_backend should be used during groups update validation
procedure  instead of 'host' attribute because it works well
both in clustered and single node deployments.

Change-Id: I4f80bb3e39e04ac5c524c7c1ad8859eef76a910a
Closes-Bug: #1876133

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-24 09:40:21.000000000', 'message': "Add validations-libs to the global-requirements

tripleoclient needs the validations-libs as dependencie, we need to
add the validations-libs to the global-requirements:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714629/

Answers to the basic requirements questions.

Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, the libraries is actively maintained and mainly used by TripleO projects

Is the library good code?

Yes the libraries is covered by CI and Unit tests

Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes

Is the library license compatible?

Yes

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Yes

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?

No

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure
setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

Yes, it's required for python-tripleoclient and TripleO projects

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it use
the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

Yes

Do I need to update anything else?

No.

Change-Id: Iec6b639fce37135f8840240b5d2a1a168bf9bb4e
"}]
commit_message:
Add validations-libs to the global-requirements

tripleoclient needs the validations-libs as dependencie, we need to
add the validations-libs to the global-requirements:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714629/

Answers to the basic requirements questions.

Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, the libraries is actively maintained and mainly used by TripleO projects

Is the library good code?

Yes the libraries is covered by CI and Unit tests

Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes

Is the library license compatible?

Yes

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Yes

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?

No

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure
setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

Yes, it's required for python-tripleoclient and TripleO projects

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it use
the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

Yes

Do I need to update anything else?

No.

Change-Id: Iec6b639fce37135f8840240b5d2a1a168bf9bb4e

subject: Bump MANILACLIENT_VERSION and use sharev2 endpoint
messages:
[{'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2020-08-10 12:47:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-08-10 13:19:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2020-08-11 10:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Bumping manilaclient version to 2.13 breaks retrieval of the export_locations attribute, which is only available until 2.8 in the "Show share details" endpoint according to https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/shared-file-system/#show-share-details'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-08-12 19:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-08-12 19:56:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

try this'}, {'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2020-08-13 07:27:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thank you for your support Zane, I was occupied with other stuff at work and did not have time to work on this.
In version 2.9 a new enpoint was created for export_locations ([1]). I think I would rather implement getting the attribute from there instead of overrriding the API version.
I know it would have been very confusing for me if changing MANILACLIENT_VERSION would not have had any effect on certain aspects of the heat resource.

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/shared-file-system/?expanded=list-export-locations-detail#list-export-locations'}, {'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2020-08-17 14:05:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-08-17 14:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2020-08-18 13:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2020-08-18 13:32:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

From my tests and from the api-ref "export_locations" in "/v2/{project_id}/shares/{share_id}" is a list, so I have changed the test to reflect this. 
Just let me know if you disagree with this approach'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-08-18 14:07:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Yeah, it looks like the return value was just incorrectly mocked before.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-08-19 03:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Jan, can you also help to add release note here? Thanks'}, {'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2020-08-20 08:44:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-08-24 18:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2020-08-25 14:21:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2020-08-25 14:22:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Thanks, let me now if there is anything else'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-08-25 18:59:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks! Approving on the basis of Rico's earlier +2."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-10 12:47:00.000000000', 'message': 'Bump MANILACLIENT_VERSION to 2.13 and use sharev2 service type

This commit bumps MANILACLIENT_VERSION to 2.13 and changes the used
service type to sharev2.

In order to support the value of "cephx" in property access_rules:access_type in
ressource OS::Manila::Share, manilaclient needs to use at least version 2.13 of
the manila API ([1]). The default minimum version in manilaclient, which is used
when only a mayor version is specified is 2.0.
Additionally the sharev2 service type endpoint has to be used to access the manila
v2 API.

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html

Change-Id: I4c37be8fad1edb05d812fed260e97e9188fd23ce
Story: 2007986
Task: 40612
'}, {'created': '2020-08-12 19:56:28.000000000', 'message': 'Bump MANILACLIENT_VERSION to 2.13 and use sharev2 service type

This commit bumps MANILACLIENT_VERSION to 2.13 and changes the used
service type to sharev2.

In order to support the value of "cephx" in property
access_rules:access_type in ressource OS::Manila::Share, manilaclient
needs to use at least version 2.13 of the manila API.[1] The default
minimum version in manilaclient, which is used when only a major version
is specified is 2.0. Additionally the sharev2 service type endpoint has
to be used to access the manila v2 API.

To access the export_locations attribute, we override the version to
2.8, which was the last version to support it.[2]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/shared-file-system/?expanded=show-share-details-detail#show-share-details

Change-Id: I4c37be8fad1edb05d812fed260e97e9188fd23ce
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Story: 2007986
Task: 40612
'}, {'created': '2020-08-17 14:05:46.000000000', 'message': 'Bump MANILACLIENT_VERSION to 2.13 and use sharev2 service type

This commit bumps MANILACLIENT_VERSION to 2.13 and changes the used
service type to sharev2.

In order to support the value of "cephx" in property access_rules:access_type in
ressource OS::Manila::Share, manilaclient needs to use at least version 2.13 of
the manila API ([1]). The default minimum version in manilaclient, which is used
when only a mayor version is specified is 2.0.
Additionally the sharev2 service type endpoint has to be used to access the manila
v2 API.

The export_locations response was removed in version 2.9 of manila API from the
"Show share details" request ([2]) and moved to its own endpoint in [3]. Thus it
is requested from there now.
Additionally the new endpoint is more verbose, so only its path attribute is
returned, in order to match the previous behaviour.

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html
[2]
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/shared-file-system/?expanded=show-single-export-location-detail,show-share-details-detail#show-share-details
[3]
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/shared-file-system/?expanded=show-single-export-location-detail,list-export-locations-detail#list-export-locations

Change-Id: I4c37be8fad1edb05d812fed260e97e9188fd23ce
Story: 2007986
Task: 40612

commit_message:
Bump MANILACLIENT_VERSION and use sharev2 endpoint

This commit bumps MANILACLIENT_VERSION to 2.13 and changes the used
service type to sharev2.

In order to support the value of "cephx" in property
'{"access_rules": [{"access_type": ""}]}' in ressource
OS::Manila::Share, manilaclient needs to use at least version 2.13 of
the manila API ([1]). The default minimum version in manilaclient, which
is used when only a mayor version is specified is 2.0.
Additionally the sharev2 service type endpoint has to be used to access
the manila v2 API.

The export_locations response was removed in version 2.9 of manila API
from the "Show share details" request ([2]) and moved to its own
endpoint in [3]. Thus it is requested from there now.
Additionally the new endpoint is more verbose, so only its path
attribute is returned, in order to match the previous behaviour.

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html
[2]
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/shared-file-system/?expanded=show-single-export-location-detail,show-share-details-detail#show-share-details
[3]
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/shared-file-system/?expanded=show-single-export-location-detail,list-export-locations-detail#list-export-locations

Change-Id: I4c37be8fad1edb05d812fed260e97e9188fd23ce
Story: 2007986
Task: 40612

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-24 18:24:31.000000000', 'message': "Prevent overwriting existing Keystone Fernet keys

Backport note: added kolla_container_facts and group_by tasks which did
not exist in Train & earlier.

Steps to reproduce:

* Deploy a cloud
* Add another controller to the inventory
* Deploy to the new controller using --limit:

kolla-ansible deploy --limit new-controller

Expected results:

The new controller uses the cluster's existing fernet keys.

Actual results:

New fernet keys are generated on the new controller, and pushed out to
the existing controllers. This invalidates tokens created from those
keys.

This change prevents the above scenario from happening, by failing the
deployment if there are no hosts with existing Ferney keys to
distribute, and not all Keystone hosts are in the target host list.

Closes-Bug: #1891364

Change-Id: If0c0e038b77fc010a3a017f9841a674d53b16457
(cherry picked from commit 8389140f0581b6c32c5ee8c7adb9d9f42bb5e321)

commit_message:
Prevent overwriting existing Keystone Fernet keys

Backport note: added kolla_container_facts and group_by tasks which did
not exist in Train & earlier.

Steps to reproduce:

* Deploy a cloud
* Add another controller to the inventory
* Deploy to the new controller using --limit:

kolla-ansible deploy --limit new-controller

Expected results:

The new controller uses the cluster's existing fernet keys.

Actual results:

New fernet keys are generated on the new controller, and pushed out to
the existing controllers. This invalidates tokens created from those
keys.

This change prevents the above scenario from happening, by failing the
deployment if there are no hosts with existing Ferney keys to
distribute, and not all Keystone hosts are in the target host list.

Closes-Bug: #1891364

Change-Id: If0c0e038b77fc010a3a017f9841a674d53b16457
(cherry picked from commit 8389140f0581b6c32c5ee8c7adb9d9f42bb5e321)

commit_message:
Disable arp_responder option for LinuxBridge agent

Enabling both l2_population and arp_responder for LinuxBridge can cause
problems in some configurations [0].  This commit removes the explicit
'true', reverting it to the default which is 'False'.

Closes-Bug: #1892776

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1661717

Change-Id: Ia9445a651fd7a082835a858964bcb9e8e325338d
Signed-off-by: Nick Jones <nick@dischord.org>
(cherry picked from commit e721c6ae0b86d9ec2184be77cd6fa0617eb5d7db)

commit_message:
Fix documentation for types and extra specs

Some content in the admin docs was incomplete,
and irrelevant to administrators.

Also add notes on a couple of missing common
capabilities:
- mount_snapshot_support
- availability_zones

Partial-Bug: #1816486
Change-Id: Ie55fd5bf80ca2ebacdb652c701aa9c213f758963

commit_message:
Update number of VM on ironic-base

Since we merged the change to have partition and wholedisk
testing on basic_ops most of the jobs started requiring 2 VMs
to run the tempest tets.

Let's increase on the ironic-base so all jobs will be default to 2.

Removing IRONIC_VM_COUNT=2 from jobs that uses ironic-base as parent.

Change-Id: I13da6275c04ffc6237a7f2edf25c03b4ddee936a
(cherry picked from commit dc87a189cb0d5bf2e96650ffd699fbaa972b7983)
(cherry picked from commit 3730c92ce35ca30ff15d5d8310f4dd37092fbb14)
(cherry picked from commit 3df540a35d567ea78b04afb3188c76c64a7e7fae)

commit_message:
Fix wrong capacity in pool_stat for DellEMC manila drivers.

DellEMC manila drivers have bugs in returning capacity in pool_stat.
The current powermax/vnx manila return size in MB and unity manila
returns size in bytes.

Change-Id: I1a2c28548d02eee6632313a41a5c4d8ab6ad9532
Closes-bug: #1890372
Closes-bug: #1890375
Closes-bug: #1890376
(cherry picked from commit 53f756d0650a815cbb9eeac2fa7bcfa2334c674a)
(cherry picked from commit ba00d1b9abe79a6569544f1b1f7f1587645f76c3)

commit_message:
Add Apparmor to Prometheus alert manager and snmp-notifier

1) Added to service account name insted of traditional pod name
   to resolve for dynamic release names.
2) Added Apparmor Job to Prometheus Alert Manager.

Change-Id: Ib65f721c5b99b3ae3d3af924ca5187ad6174ed20
Signed-off-by: diwakar thyagaraj <diwakar.chitoor.thyagaraj@att.com>

commit_message:
Remove unused exceptions

This patch cleans up cinder.exception module by deleting unused
execptions from it.

Change-Id: Idb07d69475306f43116977b5fb9b0ea863c1f65b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-22 16:19:19.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: Support non OpenStack usage

The RBD connector can get a handle to a volume when we have the config
and keyring file in the host and when all the information is provided by
the Cinder driver (including the keyring).

The code for the local attach (using krbd) does not work if all the
information is provided by the Cinder driver, which is the case of
cinderlib.

This patch ensures that the local attach/detach behaves in the same way
as when we request a handle.

For security reasons, when doing a local attach for non-OpenStack usage
the configuration file which contains the keyring will be owned by root
instead of the normal user.

Related-Bug: #1883720

commit_message:
RBD: Support non OpenStack usage

The RBD connector can get a handle to a volume when we have the config
and keyring file in the host and when all the information is provided by
the Cinder driver (including the keyring).

The code for the local attach (using krbd) does not work if all the
information is provided by the Cinder driver, which is the case of
cinderlib.

This patch ensures that the local attach/detach behaves in the same way
as when we request a handle.

For security reasons, when doing a local attach for non-OpenStack usage
the configuration file which contains the keyring will be owned by root
instead of the normal user.

Related-Bug: #1883720
Change-Id: I315f474979ea5e797e3551cdc56ef136fa7a67c0

commit_message:
Remove the ITRI DISCO connector

This driver was removed from Cinder several releases ago. This cleans up
the now unused connector from os-brick.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/745393

Change-Id: I8e892aafdfd3fcc4cd8657ec4e9ff0d9dce2e643
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-08-23 14:00:37.000000000', 'message': 'Ansible deploy - Ignore invalid devices

This change updates the ansible deploy driver to exclude
devices with "sr", "loop", and "mem" which can appear in the
devices list for consideration as the root device.

This change effectively causes them to be ignored.

Change-Id: I72a422553ee992d313b83df091af2c9deb8393b5
(cherry picked from commit 0071d28460f1c0baa449d8f7920f4cf36e876bdc)
'}]
commit_message:
Ansible deploy - Ignore invalid devices

This change updates the ansible deploy driver to exclude
devices with "sr", "loop", and "mem" which can appear in the
devices list for consideration as the root device.

This change effectively causes them to be ignored.

Change-Id: I72a422553ee992d313b83df091af2c9deb8393b5
(cherry picked from commit 0071d28460f1c0baa449d8f7920f4cf36e876bdc)

commit_message:
Install bash-completion in dev-tools

bash-completion is useful to tab-complete commands, especially docker container
names - this change adds it to default packages list for dev-tools role.

Change-Id: Ic630e0cfa059969046194b9761b9b5e07978f202

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-13 08:13:24.000000000', 'message': 'Mount /etc/timezone based on host OS

Previously we mounted /etc/timezone if the kolla_base_distro is debian
or ubuntu. This would fail prechecks if debian or ubuntu images were
deployed on CentOS. While this is not a supported combination, for
correctness we should fix the condition to reference the host OS rather
than the container OS, since that is where the /etc/timezone file is
located.

Change-Id: Ifc252ae793e6974356fcdca810b373f362d24ba5
Closes-Bug: #1882553
(cherry picked from commit 146b00efa7081eac9cba4410b5ea7e8b17535246)

commit_message:
Mount /etc/timezone based on host OS

Previously we mounted /etc/timezone if the kolla_base_distro is debian
or ubuntu. This would fail prechecks if debian or ubuntu images were
deployed on CentOS. While this is not a supported combination, for
correctness we should fix the condition to reference the host OS rather
than the container OS, since that is where the /etc/timezone file is
located.

Change-Id: Ifc252ae793e6974356fcdca810b373f362d24ba5
Closes-Bug: #1882553
(cherry picked from commit 146b00efa7081eac9cba4410b5ea7e8b17535246)

commit_message:
Remove DRBD connector

The DRBD driver was removed by the vendor in the Stein release of
Cinder. This cleans up the unused connector code.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/745393

Change-Id: I14825e5b3a01bd766d0441d61fa8149aa1bd1e65
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28570, 'date': '2020-07-06 01:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> (1 comment)
Yes, we need support both. That's a new feature for openstack-helm we need to do.
But so far, we still need this switch, otherwise we could not let it work on ipv4 only setup or ipv6 only setup.
Most of cases, when we set listener.ip to "::", it can work for both ipv6 and ipv4. but here, it doesn't work.'}, {'account_id': 28570, 'date': '2020-08-19 01:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2020-08-24 17:13:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-08-24 18:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28570, 'date': '2020-08-25 06:20:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-20 05:31:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix rabbitmq could not bind port to ipv6 address issue

When we use amarda to deploy openstack service for ipv6, rabbitmq
pod could not start listen on [::]:5672 and [::]:15672.
For ipv6, we need do some override as below.
conf:
  rabbitmq:
    management.listener.port: 15672
    management.listener.ip: "::"
  rabbitmq_env: |
    SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="+A 128 -kernel inetrc '/etc/rabbitmq/erl_inetrc' -proto_dist inet6_tcp"
    CTL_ERL_ARGS="-proto_dist inet6_tcp"
  erl_inetrc: |
    {inet6,true}.

We have test pass on both ipv4 and ipv6 setup for StarlingX project.

Signed-off-by: Zhipeng Liu <zhipengs.liu@intel.com>

Change-Id: I7af840ecd8960f9f1aa3f38d155c6e1bd822cb6e

commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq could not bind port to ipv6 address issue

When we use amarda to deploy openstack service for ipv6, rabbitmq
pod could not start listen on [::]:5672 and [::]:15672.
For ipv6, we need do some override as below.
conf:
  rabbitmq:
    management.listener.port: 15672
    management.listener.ip: "::"
  rabbitmq_env: |
    SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS="+A 128 -kernel inetrc '/etc/rabbitmq/erl_inetrc' -proto_dist inet6_tcp"
    CTL_ERL_ARGS="-proto_dist inet6_tcp"
  erl_inetrc: |
    {inet6,true}.

We have test pass on both ipv4 and ipv6 setup for StarlingX project.

Signed-off-by: Zhipeng Liu <zhipengs.liu@intel.com>

Change-Id: I7af840ecd8960f9f1aa3f38d155c6e1bd822cb6e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-10 19:43:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add lock per share for cinder nfs mount/umount

With cinder configured as glance store and nfs as cinder backend,
if we create multiple images concurrently into the same share,
there might be race conditions.
This patch ensures a lock per export to avoid the race conditions.

This patch also introduces a reference counting mechamism for unmounting
which will unmount the share if no active thread/process is using it.

Closes-Bug: #1870289

Change-Id: I9197f64e29a0ae2e0a58186f1a70aa134f7f1db6
(cherry picked from commit f5d46996139593f6249138bcc9f09b6120f0034a)

commit_message:
Add lock per share for cinder nfs mount/umount

With cinder configured as glance store and nfs as cinder backend,
if we create multiple images concurrently into the same share,
there might be race conditions.
This patch ensures a lock per export to avoid the race conditions.

This patch also introduces a reference counting mechamism for unmounting
which will unmount the share if no active thread/process is using it.

Closes-Bug: #1870289

Change-Id: I9197f64e29a0ae2e0a58186f1a70aa134f7f1db6
(cherry picked from commit f5d46996139593f6249138bcc9f09b6120f0034a)
(cherry picked from commit b37e7f2f3c3faf3b6e4d11eeb3e866211e13b85e)

2020-08-21 17:07:29.998737 | ubuntu-bionic | 2020-08-21 17:07:27.780 3807 WARNING glance.api.v2.images [req-a5e0962a-425c-4c96-8bb2-166cf10b2cd0 f9a41d13-0c13-47e9-bee2-ce4e8bfe958e ba63e3c7-95d0-4758-9b41-719e91ef493b - - -] Image 8b6d29b0-f184-4f05-8e9e-26bdcaee428d has active import task 0a322465-5f85-4e9d-a78b-a591c418f759 in status processing; lock remains valid for 3599 more seconds
2020-08-21 17:07:29.998741 | ubuntu-bionic | 2020-08-21 17:07:27.781 3807 INFO eventlet.wsgi.server [req-a5e0962a-425c-4c96-8bb2-166cf10b2cd0 f9a41d13-0c13-47e9-bee2-ce4e8bfe958e ba63e3c7-95d0-4758-9b41-719e91ef493b - - -] 127.0.0.1 - - [21/Aug/2020 17:07:27] "POST /v2/images/8b6d29b0-f184-4f05-8e9e-26bdcaee428d/import HTTP/1.1" 409 355 0.079142'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-08-21 19:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

> I can see below logs in g-api
 > 
 > 2020-08-21 17:07:29.998737 | ubuntu-bionic | 2020-08-21
 > 17:07:27.780 3807 WARNING glance.api.v2.images [req-a5e0962a-425c-4c96-8bb2-166cf10b2cd0
 > f9a41d13-0c13-47e9-bee2-ce4e8bfe958e ba63e3c7-95d0-4758-9b41-719e91ef493b
 > - - -] Image 8b6d29b0-f184-4f05-8e9e-26bdcaee428d has active import
 > task 0a322465-5f85-4e9d-a78b-a591c418f759 in status processing;
 > lock remains valid for 3599 more seconds
 > 2020-08-21 17:07:29.998741 | ubuntu-bionic | 2020-08-21
 > 17:07:27.781 3807 INFO eventlet.wsgi.server [req-a5e0962a-425c-4c96-8bb2-166cf10b2cd0
 > f9a41d13-0c13-47e9-bee2-ce4e8bfe958e ba63e3c7-95d0-4758-9b41-719e91ef493b
 > - - -] 127.0.0.1 - - [21/Aug/2020 17:07:27] "POST /v2/images/8b6d29b0-f184-4f05-8e9e-26bdcaee428d/import
 > HTTP/1.1" 409 355 0.079142

I imagine this is a race to start the next import and that it's legitimately enforcing the lock when the previous task hasn't finished reverting yet. I don't see this locally after several manual runs, but I'll try to run --until-failure and see if I can poke. Like I said during a previous discussion of this, since copy makes it hard to know when things are done-done, being able to look at the task and wait for it to reach a terminal state is definitely the most robust way to know when it's okay to start another one.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-08-21 19:53:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20: Patch Set 19 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-08-24 13:41:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21: Patch Set 20 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-08-24 16:58:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Workflow+1

Thank you Dan for working on this.'}]

Change-Id: Icb3c1d27e9a514d96fca7c1d824fd2183f69d8b3
"}, {'created': '2020-07-28 20:37:36.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Import locking

NOTE that this totally doesn't work yet, nor is it tested. I just wanted
to push up the stuff under this and maybe get the almost-pseudocode here
up for discussion.

Here is some of the logic:

1. API locks the image by task-id before we start the task thread, but
   before we return
2. Import thread will check the task-id lock on the image every time it
   tries to modify the image, and if it has changed, will abort
3. The data pipeline will heartbeat the task every minute by updating
   the task.message (bonus: we get some status)
4. If the data pipeline heartbeat ever finds the task state to be changed
   from the expected 'processing' it will abort
5. On task revert or completion, we drop the task-id lock from the image
6. If something ever gets stuck or dies, the heartbeating will stop
7. If the API gets a request for an import where the lock is held, it
   will grab the task by id (in the lock) and check the state and age.
   If the age is sufficiently old (no heartbeating) and the state is
   either 'processing' or terminal, it will mark the task as failed,
   steal the lock, and proceed.

Lots of logging throughout any time we encounter unexpected situations.

Change-Id: Icb3c1d27e9a514d96fca7c1d824fd2183f69d8b3

"}, {'created': '2020-07-29 20:09:44.000000000', 'message': "Implement time-limited import locking

This attempts to provide a time-based import lock that is dependent
on the task actually making progress. While the task is copying
data, the task message is updated, which in turn touches the task
updated_at time. The API will break any lock after 30 minutes of
no activity on a stalled or dead task. The import taskflow will
check to see if it has lost the lock at any point, and/or if its
task status has changed and abort if so.

The logic in more detail:

1. API locks the image by task-id before we start the task thread, but
   before we return
2. Import thread will check the task-id lock on the image every time it
   tries to modify the image, and if it has changed, will abort
3. The data pipeline will heartbeat the task every minute by updating
   the task.message (bonus: we get some status)
4. If the data pipeline heartbeat ever finds the task state to be changed
   from the expected 'processing' it will abort
5. On task revert or completion, we drop the task-id lock from the image
6. If something ever gets stuck or dies, the heartbeating will stop
7. If the API gets a request for an import where the lock is held, it
   will grab the task by id (in the lock) and check the state and age.
   If the age is sufficiently old (no heartbeating) and the state is
   either 'processing' or terminal, it will mark the task as failed,
   steal the lock, and proceed.

Lots of logging throughout any time we encounter unexpected situations.

Change-Id: Icb3c1d27e9a514d96fca7c1d824fd2183f69d8b3

5. On task revert or completion, we drop the task-id lock from the image
6. If something ever gets stuck or dies, the heartbeating will stop
7. If the API gets a request for an import where the lock is held, it
   will grab the task by id (in the lock) and check the state and age.
   If the age is sufficiently old (no heartbeating) and the state is
   either 'processing' or terminal, it will mark the task as failed,
   steal the lock, and proceed.

Lots of logging throughout any time we encounter unexpected situations.

Change-Id: Icb3c1d27e9a514d96fca7c1d824fd2183f69d8b3

commit_message:
Implement time-limited import locking

This attempts to provide a time-based import lock that is dependent
on the task actually making progress. While the task is copying
data, the task message is updated, which in turn touches the task
updated_at time. The API will break any lock after 30 minutes of
no activity on a stalled or dead task. The import taskflow will
check to see if it has lost the lock at any point, and/or if its
task status has changed and abort if so.

The logic in more detail:

1. API locks the image by task-id before we start the task thread, but
   before we return
2. Import thread will check the task-id lock on the image every time it
   tries to modify the image, and if it has changed, will abort
3. The data pipeline will heartbeat the task every minute by updating
   the task.message (bonus: we get some status)
4. If the data pipeline heartbeat ever finds the task state to be changed
   from the expected 'processing' it will abort
5. On task revert or completion, we drop the task-id lock from the image
6. If something ever gets stuck or dies, the heartbeating will stop
7. If the API gets a request for an import where the lock is held, it
   will grab the task by id (in the lock) and check the state and age.
   If the age is sufficiently old (no heartbeating) and the state is
   either 'processing' or terminal, it will mark the task as failed,
   steal the lock, and proceed.

Lots of logging throughout any time we encounter unexpected situations.

Closes-Bug: #1884596
Change-Id: Icb3c1d27e9a514d96fca7c1d824fd2183f69d8b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-10 19:43:00.000000000', 'message': "Add config for cinder mounting needs

This patch adds a config option 'mount_point_base' by which we can
provide the mount point for *fs volumes.
The different types of FS drivers will have separate directory for
mounting their volumes,
Eg: <mount_point_base>/nfs, <mount_point_base>/xyzfs etc.
The default mount point for *fs volumes is /var/lib/glance/mnt/*fs.

Closes-Bug: #1866966

Change-Id: I10b5ea4943ad9388ce1962eae9204b905c8ff24a
(cherry picked from commit 1a656163c9d68520ab26035d350f2568cbfb881f)
"}, {'created': '2020-07-06 20:57:32.000000000', 'message': "Add config for cinder mounting needs

commit_message:
Add config for cinder mounting needs

This patch adds a config option 'mount_point_base' by which we can
provide the mount point for *fs volumes.
The different types of FS drivers will have separate directory for
mounting their volumes,
Eg: <mount_point_base>/nfs, <mount_point_base>/xyzfs etc.
The default mount point for *fs volumes is /var/lib/glance/mnt/*fs.

Closes-Bug: #1866966

Change-Id: I10b5ea4943ad9388ce1962eae9204b905c8ff24a
(cherry picked from commit 1a656163c9d68520ab26035d350f2568cbfb881f)

commit_message:
Make test_copy_image_revert_lifecycle handle 409 on import retry

This test is very racy in general, and specifically on the post-revert
retry to do the import, it may start the next import before the previous
one has finished reverting. This patch makes it retry a few times with
delay if an HTTP 409 is received so it is tolerant of that situation once
it becomes possible in the subsequent patch to add import locking.

Change-Id: Ic933f170d43b290fd819e8527ecb60be7f7f3f89

commit_message:
Bump pysaml2 requeriment to avoid CVE-2020-5390

Although, Keystone doesn't use the pysaml2 signature on [0]
Would be nice to bump the pysaml2 version for, at least, 5.0.0[1] in
order to have the the CVE fix included[2].

[0]https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/src/branch/master/keystone/federation/idp.py#L440-L521
[1] https://github.com/IdentityPython/pysaml2/releases/tag/v5.0.0
[2] https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qf7v-8hj3-4xw7

Change-Id: I1d3776f7f1feb6485feecb140703f23027ca3a6f

commit_message:
Explicitly set permissions on /httpboot contents

Ansible versions 2.9.12 and 2.8.14 change default behavior
in regards to applying umask to ansible-created files. Due to
this, newly created files may have overly restrictive permissions,
causing issues in use cases where files need to be world-readable
such as contents of /httpboot folder in Ironic. This patch adds
explicit setting of permissions to ensure Ironic network boot
continues to work correctly.

Change-Id: If617a305d4efc09335f675f1ec68e07cf81970c6

commit_message:
Track CPU scheduler policy during live migration

Resolve a TODO by tracking the scheduler policy when recalculating CPU
pinning information during a live migration. This is really a
nice-to-have, given we only support one type of scheduler in the code at
the moment ('fifo').

Change-Id: I9b47c966f7b110c76fb82ea5530f5a42952c21cd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1889257

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-17 16:03:14.000000000', 'message': "Support Cinder multiple stores

This patch adds support for configuring multiple cinder stores.
The following changes are part of this patch:
1) location URL format: previously cinder://<volume-id>, the format is
now changed to cinder://<store-name>/<volume-id>
2) Check for configured volume types: During initialization of service,
all volume types configured in the cinder store(s) will be checked if
they exist in deployment or not, the store with the wrong type will be
disabled.
3) Update legacy images: This change is partially depedent on the glance
changes[1] which trigger updating the URL for legacy images and the
cinder store checks the configured stores volume type against the existing
image-volume's type and update it respectively.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742373/

Change-Id: I0ba36d1095886fd1d96926af37a3a65a178c004f
"}, {'created': '2020-08-19 01:30:23.000000000', 'message': "Support Cinder multiple stores

This patch adds support for configuring multiple cinder stores.
The following changes are part of this patch:
1) location URL format: previously cinder://<volume-id>, the format is
now changed to cinder://<store-name>/<volume-id>
2) Check for configured volume types: During initialization of service,
all volume types configured in the cinder store(s) will be checked if
they exist in deployment or not, the store with the wrong type will be
disabled. if cinder store is configured using traditional/old way
(i.e. using 'stores' config option) then this validation will not be performed.
3) Update legacy images: This change is partially depedent on the glance
changes[1] which trigger updating the URL for legacy images and the
cinder store checks the configured stores volume type against the existing
image-volume's type and update it respectively.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742373/

commit_message:
Support Cinder multiple stores

This patch adds support for configuring multiple cinder stores.
The following changes are part of this patch:
1) location URL format: previously cinder://<volume-id>, the format is
now changed to cinder://<store-name>/<volume-id>
2) Check for configured volume types: During initialization of service,
all volume types configured in the cinder store(s) will be checked if
they exist in deployment or not, the store with the wrong type will be
disabled. if cinder store is configured using traditional/old way
(i.e. using 'stores' config option) then this validation will not be performed.
3) Update legacy images: This change is partially depedent on the glance
changes[1] which trigger updating the URL for legacy images and the
cinder store checks the configured stores volume type against the existing
image-volume's type and update it respectively.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742373/

Implements: blueprint multiple-cinder-backend-support
Change-Id: I0ba36d1095886fd1d96926af37a3a65a178c004f

commit_message:
Drop configure_keystone_authtoken_middleware function

The configure_auth_token_middleware function has been deprecated for some time,
see [0], replace it with configure_keystone_authtoken_middleware.

There no longer is a need for an AUTH_CACHE_DIR since keystone removed PKI
support.

[0] Id0dec1ba72467cce5cacfcfdb2bc0af2bd3a3610

Change-Id: I1507cb04e812cd94c77828fe53c22200aed045b4

[{'created': '2020-08-12 15:41:35.000000000', 'message': '[TRAIN-Only] Dynamically add centos8 namespace

The container namespace is different for the python3/centos8 version of
tripleo. We need to dynamically add it as the default if not explicitly
specified via a ContainerImagePrepare setting. This change adds an
update to the defaults to ensure that the centos8 namespace is changed
in the defaults only when running under python3 and the default is
docker.io/tripleotrain.  This should prevent accidental changes when a
user specifies a specific namespace or the defaults are changed.

Change-Id: I3ff5dc84b15a81d6afcc70ab5dde2d327b3c4714
Related-Bug: #1887176
'}, {'created': '2020-08-12 16:00:18.000000000', 'message': '[TRAIN-Only] Dynamically add centos8 namespace

The container namespace is different for the python3/centos8 version of
tripleo. We need to dynamically add it as the default if not explicitly
specified via a ContainerImagePrepare setting. This change adds an
update to the defaults to ensure that the centos8 namespace is changed
in the defaults only when running under python3 and the default is
docker.io/tripleotrain.  This should prevent accidental changes when a
user specifies a specific namespace or the defaults are changed.

Change-Id: I3ff5dc84b15a81d6afcc70ab5dde2d327b3c4714
Related-Bug: #1887176
'}]
commit_message:
[TRAIN-Only] Dynamically add centos8 namespace

The container namespace is different for the python3/centos8 version of
tripleo. We need to dynamically add it as the default if not explicitly
specified via a ContainerImagePrepare setting. This change adds an
update to the defaults to ensure that the centos8 namespace is changed
in the defaults only when running under python3 and the default is
docker.io/tripleotrain.  This should prevent accidental changes when a
user specifies a specific namespace or the defaults are changed.

Change-Id: I3ff5dc84b15a81d6afcc70ab5dde2d327b3c4714
Related-Bug: #1887176

commit_message:
Use the utility host for db setup tasks

Move it to the service setup host (defaults to utility[0]) instead
of the galera[0] host, and use galera_address (defaults to internal VIP)
as the endpoint instead of a local connection on the db host.

Change-Id: I11c5b7a79e3a5b37fd5cef5aa46a1c0a6c654c9d

commit_message:
Switch from openstackcli to openstacksdk

The openstackcli is super slow at scale (e.g. many nodes) so this change
inlines a python script ot leverage openstacksdk to query the network
and port information to writeout the bmc service files and os-net-config
configuration files.

Change-Id: I1e3d8934071cde12a6be7f1212eb6a85aa2eeafd

commit_message:
Fix the buildimages jobs: call the ensure-tox role

... and use its output.

tox is not available by default on the images anymore.

Change-Id: If5ea0ffdfc51860842c19f0a6f238127d42eb292
(cherry picked from commit 2d0c3a8b9835a5616cc0cbe45db02769342695bd)

[{'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-01-14 13:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-01-17 06:54:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15397, 'date': '2020-02-18 09:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

Thank you for submitting spec draft.
Overall, the specification is well designed and matches the requirement of blueprint.
I found one minor incorrect description in the combination table at the case of 
"HA_Enabled=True, vm_state=Error, tenant_3."
And, I believe some clarification should be added in the combination with 'evacuate_all_instances' option.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-02-27 09:00:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-02-27 09:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (8 comments)
 > 
 > Thank you for submitting spec draft.
 > Overall, the specification is well designed and matches the
 > requirement of blueprint.
 > I found one minor incorrect description in the combination table at
 > the case of
 > "HA_Enabled=True, vm_state=Error, tenant_3."
 > And, I believe some clarification should be added in the
 > combination with 'evacuate_all_instances' option.

Thanks for review.
Based on the various host failure config option (New/ Existing) combinations, I have prepared a matrix to explain what action will be taken during host failure workflow for each combination. I haven't included all possible combination of config options.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-02-27 09:08:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15397, 'date': '2020-03-09 09:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Let me clarify the relation to the "evacuate_all_instances" feature.
Is it assumed both "evacuate_non_ha_enabled_to_shutoff_state" and "ignore_instances_for_tenants" are effective only if "evacuate_all_instances" is true?
If the answer is "yes," I want some description about it in this specification.'}, {'account_id': 15397, 'date': '2020-03-09 10:08:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Removing -2 for now until all open questions are not addressed.'}, {'account_id': 15397, 'date': '2020-08-25 13:40:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

Using 'HA_enable' metadata to identify 'Canaria' instances fails to satisfy the requirement of resource reservation. Because anyone can set 'HA_enable' to any value, it's not guaranteed for Masakari to securely identify 'Canaria' instances created by an operator.
If we find something to identify 'Canaria' instance securely, we may reach a better design. However, I don't have any idea better than
 using 'ignore_instances_for_projects.'"}]

[{'created': '2020-08-06 23:37:04.000000000', 'message': 'Use python3-mod_wsgi package in CentOS8

The mod_wsgi package was renamed to python3-mod_wsgi on CentOS8, and
the old name no longer works now.
This patch is a short term workaround to make the correct package
installed until puppetlabs-apache with the fix[1] is released.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/pull/2052

Change-Id: I1d29662abe630f291fc4dbcb80d439d9e7388ce8

commit_message:
Implement a common class to manage apache service

This patch introduces a new class, openstack_integration::apache, which
can be used to manage apache service in ci jobs.

Change-Id: I1d29662abe630f291fc4dbcb80d439d9e7388ce8

commit_message:
Add Centos-8 support

Reverting patch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/709532/ which is installing lsyncd using source
but now el8 epel repo providing distro rpm for lsyncd so we don't need to install from source.
also changing lsyncd.conf.lua path to /etc/lsyncd/ for centos8 support.

adding rsync-daemon rpm because centos8 islocated daemon and client in seperate package.

Change-Id: Ia8c1fad5728bd6adec510f8bc1d7bb754393de93

subject: [ci] Use stestr for coverage and fail if below 90%
messages:
[{'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-07-30 15:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-07-30 15:44:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-07-30 15:44:55.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from coverage to fix-coverage'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-07-30 15:51:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-07-31 07:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

To give magnum credit, we had coverage reports before nova, neutron, etc. Only rally had coverage in the ci.

At some point some random commiter removed the "not needed" .testr file, we (me and you) missed it in the review and unit test coverage broke. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/729147/'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-07-31 07:44:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Let's not remove files "not needed" in the future, to "clean up" or for "consistency".'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-07-31 08:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-07-31 08:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> To give magnum credit, we had coverage reports before nova,
 > neutron, etc. Only rally had coverage in the ci.
 > 
 > At some point some random commiter removed the "not needed" .testr
 > file, we (me and you) missed it in the review and unit test
 > coverage broke. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/729147/

Thanks for the review Spyros. I think it was right that .testr was removed as it has been superceded by stestr. I have updated tools/cover.sh to reflect this. I should not have prematurely removed tools/cover.sh. I initially failed to realise that it is able to flag incremental diff in coverage which I now think is quite valuable.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-07-31 08:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-07-31 10:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-07-31 10:41:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-07-31 12:36:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-07-31 13:36:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-07-31 14:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-08-04 02:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

lower the 90% threshold in the future, this can be decided then.

commit_message:
[ci] Use stestr for coverage and fail if below 90%

Additionally remove non-voting status of coverage job. 1% toleration is
enabled for allowed_extra_missing lines. If we need to lower the 90%
threshold for coverage in the future, this can be decided then.

Change-Id: I7bc80c34dc6e6e054c61181410d88e7b747310c9

commit_message:
Disable arp_responder option for LinuxBridge agent

Enabling both l2_population and arp_responder for LinuxBridge can cause
problems in some configurations [0].  This commit removes the explicit
'true', reverting it to the default which is 'False'.

Closes-Bug: #1892776

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1661717

Change-Id: Ia9445a651fd7a082835a858964bcb9e8e325338d
Signed-off-by: Nick Jones <nick@dischord.org>

commit_message:
Move redfish-virtual-media to the back of supported_boot_interfaces

Support for virtual media is still limited, we don't want it to become
the default (yet).

Change-Id: I5cd1c5acbc27f554104be13a71865748f801dbd7

subject: Cancel consumer if queue down
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-08-21 09:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-08-21 09:07:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I know that these changes introduce a new option on a stable branch but this issue exist since a while and we already had a lot of related bug opened AFAIK since ~ mikata/newton, and I think these changes could really help us to improve the situation upstream and downstream, so for this reason I think it could be really valuable to backport them on stable branches without to much risk for customers due to the fact that by default this option is turned off.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-08-21 09:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-08-21 11:37:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Although this adds a new option, it's just a gate on a bug fix to ensure we don't have unintended side effects. That actually makes this backport safer than if it just unconditionally enabled the fix."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-08-25 08:21:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2020-08-21 09:01:34.000000000', 'message': 'Cancel consumer if queue down

Previously, we have switched to use default exchanges
to avoid excessive amounts of exchange not found messages.
But it does not actually solve the problem because
reply_* queue is already gone and agent will not receive callbacks.

after some debugging, I found under some circumstances
seems rabbitmq consumer does not receive basic cancel
signal when queue is already gone. This might due to
rabbitmq try to restart consumer when queue is down
(for example when split brain). In such cases,
it might be better to fail early.

by reading the code, seems like x-cancel-on-ha-failover
is not dedicated to mirror queues only, https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/blob/master/src/rabbit_channel.erl#L1894,
https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/blob/master/src/rabbit_channel.erl#L1926.

By failing early, in my own test setup,
I could solve a certain case of exchange not found problem.

Change-Id: I2ae53340783e4044dab58035bc0992dc08145b53
Related-bug: #1789177

commit_message:
Cancel consumer if queue down

Previously, we have switched to use default exchanges
to avoid excessive amounts of exchange not found messages.
But it does not actually solve the problem because
reply_* queue is already gone and agent will not receive callbacks.

after some debugging, I found under some circumstances
seems rabbitmq consumer does not receive basic cancel
signal when queue is already gone. This might due to
rabbitmq try to restart consumer when queue is down
(for example when split brain). In such cases,
it might be better to fail early.

by reading the code, seems like x-cancel-on-ha-failover
is not dedicated to mirror queues only, https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/blob/master/src/rabbit_channel.erl#L1894,
https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/blob/master/src/rabbit_channel.erl#L1926.

By failing early, in my own test setup,
I could solve a certain case of exchange not found problem.

Change-Id: I2ae53340783e4044dab58035bc0992dc08145b53
Related-bug: #1789177
(cherry picked from commit 196fa877a90d7eb0f82ec9e1c194eef3f98fc0b1)

commit_message:
Disable CentOS7 beaker job

This patch disables CentOS7 beaker job so that we can switch to CentOS8
to run beaker tests, since CentOS7 is no longer supported.
Currently CentOS8 beaker job is still non-voting, but will be made
voting soon once we adjust current pinning for CentOS7[1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/726498/

Change-Id: Iad2dc427919788f8fc9122a05cd36d9d6e50b11a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-11 10:29:01.000000000', 'message': 'delete sub resource provider when delete resource provider

Change-Id: Ide8732be6c047ad1b141b89df676783b2fa2f25a
'}, {'created': '2020-04-13 03:00:40.000000000', 'message': 'delete sub resource provider when delete resource provider

When delete nova service by "nova service-delete <id>", this will delete the
compute node's resource provider in Placement. But if there are child resource
provider, Placement will throw exception(CannotDeleteParentResourceProvider)
and don't delete the resource provider. When we add the host service again,
Placement cannot insert new compute node resource provider, and we cannot use
the compute node any more. So we should delete sub resource provider in tree
when delete resource provider.

Modify unit test.

Change-Id: Ide8732be6c047ad1b141b89df676783b2fa2f25a
Closes-Bug: #1872385
'}, {'created': '2020-05-13 02:27:52.000000000', 'message': 'delete sub resource provider when delete resource provider

When delete nova service by "nova service-delete <id>", this will delete the
compute node's resource provider in Placement. But if there are child resource
provider, Placement will throw exception(CannotDeleteParentResourceProvider)
and don't delete the resource provider. When we add the host service again,
Placement cannot insert new compute node resource provider, and we cannot use
the compute node any more. So we should delete sub resource provider in tree
when delete resource provider.

Modify unit test.

Change-Id: Ide8732be6c047ad1b141b89df676783b2fa2f25a
Closes-Bug: #1872385

commit_message:
Delete resource provider in tree by top-down traversable order

When delete nova service by "nova service-delete <id>", this will delete the
compute node's resource provider in Placement. But if there are child resource
provider, Placement will throw exception(CannotDeleteParentResourceProvider)
and don't delete the resource provider. When we add the host service again,
Placement cannot insert new compute node resource provider, and we cannot use
the compute node any more. So we should delete sub resource provider in tree
when delete resource provider.

Modify unit test.

Change-Id: Ide8732be6c047ad1b141b89df676783b2fa2f25a
Closes-Bug: #1872385

Still WIP because we're currently running into an issue with passing the trusted_image_certificates in the create_test_server call:

DEBUG nova.api.openstack.wsgi [None req-13f7aa31-013d-41d9-95bf-03634a302ef2 tempest-ImageSigningTest-1588901414 tempest-ImageSigningTest-1588901414] Returning 400 to user: Invalid input for field/attribute server. Value: {u'trusted_image_certificates': [u'9a40caaf-54af-4b97-86fe-b4080eeb6061'], u'flavorRef': u'1', u'name': u'tempest-ImageSigningTest-server-634016441', u'imageRef': u'2cc8c5a3-4715-49eb-bf63-81f5ffb4a36e'}. Additional properties are not allowed (u'trusted_image_certificates' was unexpected) {{(pid=13157) __call__ /opt/stack/nova/nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py:1029}}"}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-10-25 22:06:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

trusted_image_certificates parameter needs to be specified in all calls to create_test_server (i.e., test_volume_encryption and test_ephemeral_disk_encryption)'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-10-25 23:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-11-30 20:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-11-30 20:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-07 19:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-07 22:33:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-08 18:02:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-08 18:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2017-12-08 21:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)

It looks like the API version is now set to 2.57 successfully: http://logs.openstack.org/10/515210/11/check/barbican-simple-crypto-devstack-tempest/619db62/logs/screen-n-api.txt.gz#_Dec_08_19_26_06_679296'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-08 22:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-08 23:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-09 03:55:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-11 19:51:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2017-12-11 21:11:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)

It looks like there are two types of failures (see http://logs.openstack.org/10/515210/15/check/barbican-simple-crypto-devstack-tempest/7d1973a/logs/testr_results.html.gz )

1. The resource could not be found -- this appears to be security_groups. If you remove the "security_group = self._create_security_group()" lines and the "security_groups=[{'name': security_group['name']}]," lines, this error shouldn't happen.

2. Could not locate the signing certificate for the base certificate in the set of trusted certificates.
This is because the certificate isn't configured properly (see a clearer error at: http://logs.openstack.org/10/515210/15/check/barbican-simple-crypto-devstack-tempest/7d1973a/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Dec_11_20_37_28_823271 )'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-11 21:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)

Thanks for the help with parsing the logs, @Brianna. Is there no longer a need to create a test server with a test security group?'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2017-12-11 21:36:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

@Jackie: I don't think the security group is needed anymore, since it's been deprecated since microversion 2.36: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/api-ref/source/os-security-groups.inc"}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-11 21:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-12 15:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

It looks like floating IPs are also deprecated [1][2]. Is there any reason barbican-tempest-plugin uses its own manager.py, rather than just importing from tempest.scenario?

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/10/515210/16/check/barbican-simple-crypto-devstack-tempest/38c019e/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-12-11_22_40_28_218112
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/api-ref/source/os-floating-ips.inc'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2017-12-12 15:34:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

@Jackie: All tempest plugins were instructed to copy manager.py locally while refactoring took place in tempest.  Now that the refactoring is complete, barbican-tempest-plugin should have its own manager.py deleted, and import directly from tempest instead.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-12 16:28:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

@Brianna: Can do. Is it acceptable to do that in this patch, or should we create a separate patch for that transition?

It doesn't look like the deprecation of the proxy APIs (security groups [1], floating IPs, and images [3]) is reflected in tempest's latest manager.py [4]. Removing the creation and use of security groups eliminates the "Object not found" error for security_groups, but the same error still occurs for floating IPs and compute_images_client [5] and is much more tedious to remediate.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/api-ref/source/os-security-groups.inc
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/api-ref/source/os-floating-ips.inc
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/api-ref/source/images.inc
[4] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/scenario/manager.py
[5] https://github.com/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin/blob/master/barbican_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/test_image_signing.py#L76'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2017-12-12 16:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

@Jackie: I think a separate patch should be created to remove the local manager.py

As for the other deprecated options, would it be possible to use the default API (2.1) for all of the tests except for the specific certificate validation tests that require 2.57?'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-12 18:04:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

@Brianna: Yes, it is possible to have all of the tests except the tests specific to certificate validation use API microversion 2.1. We would need to specify it at the top of each test class, since barbican_manager has been modified to retrieve the API microversion from each class (specified as `min_microversion`).

However, I think using different microversions like this would be problematic: For this test, we need to enable certificate validation in the nova configurations. This means that any attempts to create a test server without specifying trusted image certificates would fail. At the same time, since API 2.1 does not support the trusted_image_certificates parameter, we are not able to specify the trusted image certificates...'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2017-12-12 18:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

@Jackie: I think there's a way to get around the other tests failing.

See the nova spec at: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/queens/approved/nova-validate-certificates.html

"It is possible a silent fail scenario could occur if (1) nova is not configured to conduct certificate validation, and (2) the user provides trusted certificate IDs expecting certificate validation to occur. In this case, nova would not conduct certificate validation and would boot the instance, causing the user to believe certificate validation succeeded even though it never happened. To prevent this from happening, the boot workflow will be updated to conduct signature and certificate verification if trusted certificate IDs are associated with the instance data. This matches the user’s expectations and prevents a silent fail scenario from ever occurring. Note here that this override only occurs if the user specifies certificate IDs. The default list of certificate IDs is only used if the feature is enabled and therefore will never trigger the override."

We could set enable_certificate_validation to false, but the cert validation should still occur as long as we provide the certificate ids.  We can confirm that it happens by providing both a correctly signed certificate and an incorrectly-signed certificate, and show that the latter fails while the former succeeds.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-12 19:06:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

@Brianna: I don't think the current state of the certificate validation patches will allow that. We need to update patch 479949 to validate certificates when trusted_certs are supplied, rather than checking the enable_certificate_validation configuration.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/479949/22/nova/image/glance.py"}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2017-12-12 19:32:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

@Jackie: Agreed, an update is needed to that patch.  It should perform certificate validation if the enable_certificate_validation is True and/or if trusted_certs is provided.

I determined that the "bad signing certificate" is actually not invalid, and should be modified so that cursive won't identify it as a valid signing certificate.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2017-12-12 22:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-12-12 22:44:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

as we expect with no traceback logged. So that looks all good.

Then we have test_signed_image_upload_and_boot:

http://logs.openstack.org/10/515210/31/check/barbican-simple-crypto-devstack-tempest/5379cd4/logs/screen-n-api.txt.gz#_Apr_13_16_53_25_885050

as we expect. And the instance finishes spawning here, though for some reason the request-id has changed by this point (?):

http://logs.openstack.org/10/515210/31/check/barbican-simple-crypto-devstack-tempest/5379cd4/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Apr_13_16_53_33_502262'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-13 22:40:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

The cert validation tests were updated to be run in their own file, instead of alongside the image signing tests, so that the image signing tests could still be run against pike and queens (which don't have cert validation support).

The pike barbican tempest plugin tests still pass when run with these updates.  See: http://logs.openstack.org/64/576564/1/check/barbican-simple-crypto-devstack-tempest/2aa0786/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-06-21_23_57_51_747216

The queens barbican tempest plugin tests also pass when run with these updates.  See: http://logs.openstack.org/19/577319/1/check/barbican-simple-crypto-devstack-tempest/73a2fa9/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-06-21_23_53_47_751712

All of this patches this was dependent on have now merged."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:13:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Patch Set 44 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-06-06 11:11:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 45: Code-Review+1

I found this after working on Ib346d383c430d5151d9aafa6e856dd0a7cae8a23 where I noticed tempest.api.compute.servers.test_servers.ServerShowV263Test was racing in some environments and actually attempting to validate image certificates.

My changes there shouldn't impact this work but if we wanted to test tempest.api.compute.servers.test_servers.ServerShowV263Test somewhere in Barbican we would need to pass a valid image and certificates through the new configurables I'm introducing.

Alternately we could just remove that test from Tempest and recreate it here.

Either way for now this change LGTM after a rebase and is still passing."}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2019-08-06 16:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27781, 'date': '2019-08-14 15:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-09-26 06:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2019-10-12 08:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28935, 'date': '2019-10-13 14:39:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2019-10-13 15:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2019-10-31 05:41:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-11-26 09:32:25.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Lee Yarwood with the following votes:

commit_message:
Add certificate validation scenario tests

This patch adds certificate validation scenario tests
incorporate cursive's new certificate validation feature.

Change-Id: Ica1d32ca66d6f89692e9cc90e415bf569332f58d
Implements: blueprint nova-validate-certificates

It needs to be backported fro ussuri and train also as precommit gets installed from git and here https://review.opendev.org/#/c/747724/ is broken also on stable/train https://80a05f8a8678e65f0b5c-eb0a5b05669bc8730a6c9efdcc0969f3.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/747724/2/check/openstack-tox-pep8/ce29a90/job-output.txt

 An unexpected error has occurred: AssertionError: BUG: expected environment for python to be healthy() immediately after install, please open an issue describing your environment'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2020-08-25 05:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/ussuri as commit c75031b07fbe8c428c84bcfcfe13bd117e915db1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2020-08-25 09:24:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> It needs to be backported fro ussuri and train also as precommit
 > gets installed from git

pre-commit appears to be more trouble than it's worth to me. I don't understand why we're using it."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-08-25 10:47:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Ask me on irc, and I can explain. It does management of linters much easier, something tox is not able to do. Even tox itself is using it for its own linting.

In this case the issue was 100% caused by us, not pre-commit.'}]

[{'created': '2020-08-24 08:52:11.000000000', 'message': 'Pin pre-commit to <2.7.0

"An unexpected error has occurred: AssertionError: BUG: expected environment
for python to be healthy() immediately after install, please open an issue
describing your environment"

Change-Id: I52cf07c0965c60d2b5149ccea136e53f261be42d

commit_message:
Fix linters

- fixes conflicts between virtualenv and pre-commit
- removes custom symlink detection that was not portable with
  already existing symlink check.
- updated bashate config to not be verbose
- updated outdated ansible-lint hook calling method

Change-Id: I52cf07c0965c60d2b5149ccea136e53f261be42d

commit_message:
Create container config scripts with a new module

Replace a complex copy/loop task by using a new module which will make
logging better and deployment eventually a bit faster.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/746218
Change-Id: I3e8fae54aa1fb56ce8e3a5967aef7f751e9d2c6e
(cherry picked from commit 1e1ea11be963f4dacd93847691458c14f5b32fab)

commit_message:
[hca] Use fedora:rawhide now that greenlet 0.4.16 is released

In Change-Id: Ice75ae880925cd15c096eb6d1cdabf7f802bccde, we pinned
fedora:32 but now that greenlet 0.4.16 is released with support for
Python 3.9, we can unpin this.

Story: 2007264
Task: 39967

Pin pip version to install in tinyipa images

Since pip needs to be the same during the entire process, let's
pin a version that is supposed to work and use it on both
build and finalise scripts.

commit_message:
[k8s-atomic] Support master_lb_allowed_cidrs in template

In I157a3b01d169e550e79b94316803fde8ddf77b03, support for
master_lb_allowed_cidrs  was introduced but only for the fedora coreos
driver. However, this parameter is also supplied to fedora atomic
clusters but the template does not expect this parameter. As a result,
cluster creation fails due to backward incompatibility. This PS
addresses this issue.

Task: 40632
Story: 2007478

Change-Id: Ia781288f7aa35146582b10d5762aa05e3b107dce
(cherry picked from commit ffed8839595b5291bbf867170120096b7fde21c8)

commit_message:
Remove zuul legacy jobs

As part of the Victoria cycle, all legacy jobs need to either be
converted or dropped. Since we no longer use these jobs that have been
parked in the experimental queue, it makes sense to drop them.

Change-Id: I16f15d8fb6887ff9076b20d473d9d39cec455b96

commit_message:
Configure placeholder role-mapping Sync

 + Adds placeholder ConfigMap and with a template
   keystone-sync-policy that can be edited by the cluster
   admin
 + Docs for sync policy added
 + Docs for auth policy edited for grammar, spelling
   and clarity.

Task: 39136
Story: 1755770

Change-Id: I0afc19c630e077c079f7f6a52439f4aee8bf5eb8
